results.brief_description: Depicts the passage of a cold front breaking a summer heat wave. Blends the themes of the experience of weather in the city and the scientific concept of air masses and frontal systems.

results.title: Cold days = Hideg napok [NTSC]
results.brief_description: Considered one of the most important Hungarian films of the 1960s, “Cold Days’ courageously tackled the theme of the Hungarian role in World War II, a previously taboo subject within Hungarian society. The film is based on events that occurred in the winter of 1942, when the Hungarian Army massacred over 3,000 Serbian and Hungarian nationals, mostly Jews, in the town of Ujvidek (now Novi Sad, Serbia). Kovacs’ remarkable film about this incident is both a grim record of the atrocity as well as a meditation on the memory of it. The film is structured around the recollections and self-justification of four men involved in the massacre as they await trial in 1946. Stark black and white photography conveys an atmosphere of coldness and remoteness, visually linking the emotional detachment and denials of the perpetrators with stark images of the massacre itself. Based on the short novel by Tibor Cseres. Cast includes Zoltan Latinovits, Ivan Darvas, Adam Szirtes and Ibor Szilagyi.

results.title: Cold comfort
results.creator_credit: Jack White, Infomotion, Community Education Publication Association and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Cold comfort is a lively and incisive documentary on the local and global consequences of the decision to export Australia’s uranium. Includes the true story of Maralinga, the impact of the Black Mist on the Aboriginal people and revealing footage od the consequences of uranium mining in one of Australia’s magnifican tropical wetlands. Also looks a the nuclear industry in response to global events such as the disasters at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl. Narrated by Jennifer Robinson.

results.title: Cold comfort
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Damian Brown
results.brief_description: Highlights the potential danger from bacteria if frozen food is incorrectly handled. The key is to maintain strict temperature control. Covers all aspects from the handling of fresh food by the processor through freezing, storage transportation in refrigerated containers or trucks, handling by supermarkets and other sales outlets, transportation by the consumer and handling in the home. Suitabvle for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Cold Chisel: last stand
results.creator_credit: John McLean, Next Vision and Tony Stevens
results.brief_description: For 10 years Cold Chisel defied the trends of industry conventions and inspired a legion of loyal fans which elevated them to a status unmatched in the history of Australian rock’n’roll. ‘Last stand’ is a feature length film which combines the story of Cold Chisel’s career, with multi-camera coverage of their farewell concert at the Sydney entertainment Centre in 1983. The film features live performances of 16 classical Chisel songs, with excerpts from many more underscoring the behind-the-scenes and archival footage. Interviews are conducted with band members Jimmy Barnes, Ian Moss, Don Walker, Phil Small and Steve Prestwich, as well as other music industry colleagues. Features the following tracks: “Standing on the outside”, “Cheap wine”, “Rising sun”, “Khe sanh”, “Janelle”, “Twentieth century”, “You got nothing I want”, “Tomorrow”, “Star hotel”, “Choir girl”, “Bow river”, “Flame trees”, “Saturday night”, “Wild thing”, “Goodbye (Astrid goodbye)” and “Don’t let go”.

results.title: Cold chips
results.creator_credit: Udi Eichler, Laurens Postma and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Take Six”.
A creative collaboration between Laurens C. Postma and gifted actor and one-man show performer Tim Thomas, this light-hearted entertainment is the story of a possible person in the not too distant silicone/micro-processor future. It is a future that gratifies every conceivable wish but fails to meet the basic need for human contact.

results.title: Cold-rodders
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB and Claude Larue
results.brief_description: An amusing view of the machine that has taken the country by winter storm: the snowmobile, revving, raring, ready to go. What the motorboat was to the summer lake, this motorized sled now is to the snow-covered fields. This film shows it all - the pull of this sit-down sport, the eagerness of the trade to keep it booming, the daring rivalry of the racing crowd, and the bemused pleasure of the family outing.
